poem:
**Voices in the Wind**

In Tipperary's fields,
twenty-one hearts spun,
each voice a thread,
each breath a hymn.
Ryan's craft, a loom of souls;
we stopped to hear
the silent cries
that stitch a dying town
to life's sorrowed hem.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Heart, Be at Peace by Donal Ryan review – bravura small-town chorus Donal Ryan made a stir straight out of the gate. His first novel, The Spinning Heart, published a dozen years ago, won the Guardian first book award and was longlisted for the Booker prize. A work of choral elegance, it is told in a sequence of 21 voices, inhabitants of a community in County Tipperary, Ireland – where Ryan himself is from – and unspooled". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
